answers.answer: Common symptoms of diabetes include:● Excessive thirst and appetite● Increased urination (sometimes as often as every hour)● Unusual weight loss or gain● Fatigue● Nausea, perhaps vomiting● Blurred vision● Dry mouth● Slow-healing sores or cuts● Itching skin, especially in the groin or vaginal areChills and nausea can mean also an internal infection is brewing. I suggest you get off the computer and call your doctor for an evaluation, it is cold/flu season. Good luck

Hi,It seems to me that you'd like to find out if you a diabetic.If so, then  go buy a self- test  called A1C Now available at Walmart for $23 USD, this kit is made by Bayer and is VERY reliable.. Follow instruction, then within 5-10 minutes, voila your A1C reading is there.If you want to know what the A1C reading means then google it on the internet. Good luck.

question: Are chills and nausea symptoms of a diabetic problem?
